medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple episodes of loose mucousy bowel movements and abdominal discomfort.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days ago with multiple episodes of loose mucousy bowel movements. The following day, the patient noted abdominal discomfort located to the right and just below the umbilicus, followed by one episode of rigors and a second episode of rigors upon presentation to the emergency department. Mild nausea was present, but there was no emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diverticulosis, rectal cancer, hypercholesterolemia, bladder cancer status post intravesicular BCG treatment, tuberculous prostatitis, chronic back pain, and suspected aortic valve thickening. Previous surgeries include open cholecystectomy, right inguinal hernia repair with recurrence, transanal excision of rectal tumor, Altmeier procedure, and left inguinal hernia repair.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes colon cancer in the father.
